alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Henderson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 12:02PM EST until February 05 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...Kentucky... Ohio River at Newburgh Dam affecting Warrick, Henderson, Daviess, Spencer and Vanderburgh Counties. .Heavy rainfall that fell over the last week will continue to cause rises on the Ohio River. At Newburgh, The Ohio River is forecast to rise above flood stage early Tuesday and crest at 41.2 feet Friday afternoon. For the Ohio River...including Owensboro, Newburgh Dam, Evansville, Henderson, Mount Vernon, J.T. Myers Dam, Shawneetown, Golconda, Smithland Dam, Paducah, Olmsted Lock and Dam, Cairo...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT TO MONDAY, FEBRUARY 05... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River at Newburgh Dam. * WHEN...From late Monday night to Monday, February 05. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CST Sunday the stage was 33.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 35.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Tuesday morning to a crest of 41.2 feet early Friday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Monday, February 05. - Flood stage is 38.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
